case.name: Lee v Minister for Immigration & Citizenship [2008] FCA 1023 (27 June 2008)

citation.tocase: Goldie v Commonwealth of Australia [2002] FCA 261
citation.text: 15 Sections 147 and 148 are "enacted in the public interest in the administration of justice" and "are, on the face of it, not intended to create any rights or privileges on the part of the unlawful non-citizen": Goldie v Commonwealth of Australia [2002] FCA 261 at [36] per French J. Similar observations are applicable to s 151 in my view, and see, to a similar effect, In the matter of an application by Solomon Barudea for a warrant under s 151(1) of the Migration Act 1958 (Cth) [1995] VSC 55 at [22] .

citation.tocase: In the matter of an application by Solomon Barudea for a warrant under s 151(1) of the Migration Act 1958 (Cth) [1995] VSC 55
citation.text: 15 Sections 147 and 148 are "enacted in the public interest in the administration of justice" and "are, on the face of it, not intended to create any rights or privileges on the part of the unlawful non-citizen": Goldie v Commonwealth of Australia [2002] FCA 261 at [36] per French J. Similar observations are applicable to s 151 in my view, and see, to a similar effect, In the matter of an application by Solomon Barudea for a warrant under s 151(1) of the Migration Act 1958 (Cth) [1995] VSC 55 at [22] .
